de.systemagmbh.tools.logger.formatter
Class CSysCompatibilityLogFormatter

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.logger.formatter.ASysLogFormatter
      de.systemagmbh.tools.logger.formatter.CSysCompatibilityLogFormatter
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISysComponent, ISysLogFormatter
public class CSysCompatibilityLogFormatter
extends ASysLogFormatter

The CSysCompatibilityFormatter builds a log output containing the date, the process id, the log level of the message, the part of the application that called the log method and the message itself. This is built in the same way the SystemaClasses1 logger formatted the log files.
The proces id is generated within the formatter in the init method.
The configuration must contain the following entries to configure the formatter:

DateFormat (This item is optional.)

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich

Method Detail

init

public void init(ISysConfigItem configItem)
          throws CSysConfigException
Call this method to configure the formatter from a section in the configuration.

Parameters:
configItem - The item in the configuration that contains the formatter data.
Throws:
CSysConfigException - if the items needed by the implementation are not available in the configuration.

formatLog

public String formatLog(String componentName,
                        Object toBeLogged,
                        int level,
                        Properties addOns)
This method defines the way, how a logger will format the log output.

Parameters:
componentName - The name of the application part that called the log method.
This is used for the component log levels!
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
toBeLogged - The object that has to be logged.
level - The level that is used for logging the given text.
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
addOns - The parameters for formatting this log output as Properties. These parameters are not set for all the following log outputs. (Use method setProperties for this.)
Returns:
the formatted log output
See Also:
ISysLogFormatter.formatLog(String, Object, int, Properties)

setProperty

public void setProperty(String key,
                        String value)
The properties that can be set for this ISysLogFormatter are

DateFormat = The date format to create a SimpleDateFormat.
PID = The process id. (This may have maximum length 10.)
